If everyone ate less animal foods, the CO2 from food production would drop by 68%. Just by changing our food choices, we could be halfway to stopping climate change.

Climate change will mostly affect us young people because we will see its outcomes in our lifetime. Instead of being cynical, let's look for small, effective changes that we can make right now. Choosing more plant-based meals or snacks when possible is one of the easiest things we can do.

You can also find out which foods are especially harmful for to climate (hint: the farm animal that is worst for the climate rhymes with ‚Äòwow‚Äô).

neutral_message: More than 70% of farm animals in the UK are raised on factory farms to keep animal products cheap. On these farms, a chicken has only about the space of a laptop, so there's hardly any room to move. It's like living under a staircase, like Harry Potter, for your whole life.\n\nFactory farms keep going because people buy their products. By choosing to eat less meat or plant-based meats when we can, we can send a message to these farms to make better living conditions for their animals.

neutral_message: Most pigs and chickens in the UK are kept indoors their whole lives and never see sunlight. Animals that can't go outside are more stressed and, scientists say, much less happy.\n\nWe may not be able to change how animals are treated on these farms directly. But we can choose more vegetables and meat alternatives (like plant-based schnitzel, sausages, and burgers) instead of animal meat. This is the quickest way to help make animals' lives better.

\n#####\n\nHere is a target text written without any style {Reducing how much meat we eat can help save a lot of CO2, which causes climate change. For example, if we eat meat every other day instead of every day for a year, it saves as much CO2 as driving a car from London to China‚Ä¶ and back!\n\nWith small changes like this, everyone can help the environment and slow down climate change now without waiting for others! Let‚Äôs start small;  for example, we can try to eat meat only once a day, instead of having it at breakfast, lunch, and dinner.}\nHere is the target text rewritten in the conversational style of person X: {\n\n\n

neutral_message:
If everyone ate less animal foods, the CO2 from food production would drop by 68%. Just by changing our food choices, we could be halfway to stopping climate change.

Climate change will mostly affect us young people because we will see its outcomes in our lifetime. Instead of being cynical, let's look for small, effective changes that we can make right now. Choosing more plant-based meals or snacks when possible is one of the easiest things we can do.

You can also find out which foods are especially harmful for to climate (hint: the farm animal that is worst for the climate rhymes with ‚Äòwow‚Äô).

If everyone ate less animal foods, the CO2 from food production would drop by 68%. Just by changing our food choices, we could be halfway to stopping climate change.

Climate change will mostly affect us young people because we will see its outcomes in our lifetime. Instead of being cynical, let's look for small, effective changes that we can make right now. Choosing more plant-based meals or snacks when possible is one of the easiest things we can do.

You can also find out which foods are especially harmful for to climate (hint: the farm animal that is worst for the climate rhymes with ‚Äòwow‚Äô).

neutral_message:
If everyone ate less animal foods, the CO2 from food production would drop by 68%. Just by changing our food choices, we could be halfway to stopping climate change.

Climate change will mostly affect us young people because we will see its outcomes in our lifetime. Instead of being cynical, let's look for small, effective changes that we can make right now. Choosing more plant-based meals or snacks when possible is one of the easiest things we can do.

You can also find out which foods are especially harmful for to climate (hint: the farm animal that is worst for the climate rhymes with ‚Äòwow‚Äô).

neutral_message:
If everyone ate less animal foods, the CO2 from food production would drop by 68%. Just by changing our food choices, we could be halfway to stopping climate change.

Climate change will mostly affect us young people because we will see its outcomes in our lifetime. Instead of being cynical, let's look for small, effective changes that we can make right now. Choosing more plant-based meals or snacks when possible is one of the easiest things we can do.

You can also find out which foods are especially harmful for to climate (hint: the farm animal that is worst for the climate rhymes with ‚Äòwow‚Äô).

neutral_message:
If everyone ate less animal foods, the CO2 from food production would drop by 68%. Just by changing our food choices, we could be halfway to stopping climate change.

Climate change will mostly affect us young people because we will see its outcomes in our lifetime. Instead of being cynical, let's look for small, effective changes that we can make right now. Choosing more plant-based meals or snacks when possible is one of the easiest things we can do.

You can also find out which foods are especially harmful for to climate (hint: the farm animal that is worst for the climate rhymes with ‚Äòwow‚Äô).

and the corresponding sentences written without any style.
Your task is to learn the conversational style of person X, and rewrite a target text without any style to a text with a conversational style of person X.

The text length of the newly created target text cannot deviate more than +-25% from the original target text.

For conversational style please consider 1. how person X uses function words (e.g., pronouns such as "I", "we", "you"), 2. which tone person X prefers (e.g., formal/informal vs. analytical vs. narrative), and 3. often used stylistic words (e.g., phrases, fillers words), 4. emoji or emoticon-use in the provided example sentences and 5. other stylistic characteristics you find.Please only add words/phrases/fillers/emoticons/emojis that person X explicitly uses in the example sentences. 
 Only add any variations of ‚Äòhaha‚Äô if appropriate (in a humorous context.)"). 
Return results in a json object as {"rewritten_sentence": "", "explanation": ""} 
#####
Here is an example sentence written without any style: I do not really like sports much. What do you like about football?
Here is the example sentence rewritten in the style of person X: No I dont really like sports much. What do you like about football

Here is an example sentence written without any style: I do not really like watching football, as it is just someone kicking a ball. I believe there are far more interesting things to watch on TV. Do you watch women's football?
Here is the example sentence rewritten in the style of person X: I dont really like watching football to me its just some one kicking a ball, I feel like there is far more interesting things to watch on the TV. Do watch womens football? 

Here is an example sentence written without any style: I do not like football and I cannot stand it. Do you like football?
Here is the example sentence rewritten in the style of person X: No I do not like football, I cant stand it. How about you do you like football?

Here is an example sentence written without any style: I spoke to someone recently who likes football.
Here is the example sentence rewritten in the style of person X: I had someone that I chatted to just now that likes football.

Here is an example sentence written without any style: My family supports Manchester United. I do not remember the name. What about your family?
Here is the example sentence rewritten in the style of person X: My family supports Man united. I cant even remember the name. What about your family

Here is an example sentence written without any style: Have you watched major events like the World Cup?
Here is the example sentence rewritten in the style of person X: Do you watch the big games like the world cup?

Here is an example sentence written without any style: I find it really boring to watch people kicking a ball; there are far better things to watch. I am also on my phone when the big games are on.
Here is the example sentence rewritten in the style of person X: I find it really boring just some people kicking a ball, far better things to watch, I am like you also on my Phone when the big games are on

Here is an example sentence written without any style: Have you watched major events like the World Cup?
Here is the example sentence rewritten in the style of person X: Do you watch the big games like the world cup?

Here is an example sentence written without any style: I enjoy sports such as swimming, arts and crochet, and going on holidays with my family.
Here is the example sentence rewritten in the style of person X: I like doing sports like swimming, I like doing arts and crochet, and going on holidays with my family. What about you?

Here is an example sentence written without any style: I have made and sold outfits and bags.
Here is the example sentence rewritten in the style of person X: I have made outfits and bags and have sold them

Here is an example sentence written without any style: I go swimming with my family twice a week at our local gym.
Here is the example sentence rewritten in the style of person X: I usually go swimming with my family twice a week, to our local gym



#####

Here is a target text written without any style {Reducing how much meat we eat can help save a lot of CO2, which causes climate change. For example, if we eat meat every other day instead of every day for a year, it saves as much CO2 as driving a car from London to China‚Ä¶ and back!

With small changes like this, everyone can help the environment and slow down climate change now without waiting for others! Let‚Äôs start small;  for example, we can try to eat meat only once a day, instead of having it at breakfast, lunch, and dinner.}
Here is the target text rewritten in the conversational style of person X: {

neutral_message:
If everyone ate less animal foods, the CO2 from food production would drop by 68%. Just by changing our food choices, we could be halfway to stopping climate change.

Climate change will mostly affect us young people because we will see its outcomes in our lifetime. Instead of being cynical, let's look for small, effective changes that we can make right now. Choosing more plant-based meals or snacks when possible is one of the easiest things we can do.

You can also find out which foods are especially harmful for to climate (hint: the farm animal that is worst for the climate rhymes with ‚Äòwow‚Äô).

and the corresponding sentences written without any style.
Your task is to learn the conversational style of person X, and rewrite a target text without any style to a text with a conversational style of person X.

The text length of the newly created target text cannot deviate more than +-25% from the original target text.

For conversational style please consider 1. how person X uses function words (e.g., pronouns such as "I", "we", "you"), 2. which tone person X prefers (e.g., formal/informal vs. analytical vs. narrative), and 3. often used stylistic words (e.g., phrases, fillers words), 4. emoji or emoticon-use in the provided example sentences and 5. other stylistic characteristics you find.Please only add words/phrases/fillers/emoticons/emojis that person X explicitly uses in the example sentences. 
 Only add any variations of ‚Äòhaha‚Äô if appropriate (in a humorous context.)"). 
Return results in a json object as {"rewritten_sentence": "", "explanation": ""} 
#####
Here is an example sentence written without any style: Where did you get this game?
Here is the example sentence rewritten in the style of person X: from where did you get this game?

Here is an example sentence written without any style: Who found it?
Here is the example sentence rewritten in the style of person X: and who did the find it ?

Here is an example sentence written without any style: I need to have more of this kind of games, that's why
Here is the example sentence rewritten in the style of person X: I need to have this kind of games more that's why 

Here is an example sentence written without any style: My account in Norsta was blocked.
Here is the example sentence rewritten in the style of person X: the block my account in Norsta

Here is an example sentence written without any style: The money goes there, not the game.
Here is the example sentence rewritten in the style of person X: it's just the money go there not the game 

Here is an example sentence written without any style: I am playing for free now.
Here is the example sentence rewritten in the style of person X: so i'm playing now for free ü§£

Here is an example sentence written without any style: I tried to send, but they did not answer.
Here is the example sentence rewritten in the style of person X: i tried to send they didn't answer  

Here is an example sentence written without any style: Did you get the game from Norstat?
Here is the example sentence rewritten in the style of person X: did you get the game from norstat ?

Here is an example sentence written without any style: Do you like football?
Here is the example sentence rewritten in the style of person X: do you like football?

Here is an example sentence written without any style: I do not know where he is from.
Here is the example sentence rewritten in the style of person X: I don't know where he is from ü§£

Here is an example sentence written without any style: It is not you.
Here is the example sentence rewritten in the style of person X: it's not you ü§£

Here is an example sentence written without any style: Who did not like football?
Here is the example sentence rewritten in the style of person X: who didn't like football ?

Here is an example sentence written without any style: You do not like football, Bonucy?
Here is the example sentence rewritten in the style of person X: so you don't like football Bonucy ?

Here is an example sentence written without any style: Nice to meet you, bouncy dog.
Here is the example sentence rewritten in the style of person X: Bouncy dog nice to meet you 



#####

Here is a target text written without any style {If everyone ate less animal foods, the CO2 from food production would drop by 68%. Just by changing our food choices, we could be halfway to stopping climate change.

Climate change will mostly affect us young people because we will see its outcomes in our lifetime. Instead of being cynical, let's look for small, effective changes that we can make right now. Choosing more plant-based meals or snacks when possible is one of the easiest things we can do.

You can also find out which foods are especially harmful for to climate (hint: the farm animal that is worst for the climate rhymes with ‚Äòwow‚Äô).}
Here is the target text rewritten in the conversational style of person X: {

neutral_message: Animal farming is responsible for 80% of the loss of the Amazon rainforest because farmers need space for cattle and cattle food. Last year, the Amazon rainforest lost as many trees as there are in the UK and Ireland combined. Imagine if there were not a single tree left here!\n\nBy eating less meat (like choosing veggie burgers instead of regular burgers for lunch), we can make a difference without needing to change much. If you eat with others, you can also set an example and inspire your friends and classmates, to be more mindful about their food choices as well.

If everyone ate less animal foods, the CO2 from food production would drop by 68%. Just by changing our food choices, we could be halfway to stopping climate change.

Climate change will mostly affect us young people because we will see its outcomes in our lifetime. Instead of being cynical, let's look for small, effective changes that we can make right now. Choosing more plant-based meals or snacks when possible is one of the easiest things we can do.

You can also find out which foods are especially harmful for to climate (hint: the farm animal that is worst for the climate rhymes with ‚Äòwow‚Äô).

neutral_message: More than 70% of farm animals in the UK are raised on factory farms to keep animal products cheap. On these farms, a chicken has only about the space of a laptop, so there's hardly any room to move. It's like living under a staircase, like Harry Potter, for your whole life.\n\nFactory farms keep going because people buy their products. By choosing to eat less meat or plant-based meats when we can, we can send a message to these farms to make better living conditions for their animals.

neutral_message: Most pigs and chickens in the UK are kept indoors their whole lives and never see sunlight. Animals that can't go outside are more stressed and, scientists say, much less happy.\n\nWe may not be able to change how animals are treated on these farms directly. But we can choose more vegetables and meat alternatives (like plant-based schnitzel, sausages, and burgers) instead of animal meat. This is the quickest way to help make animals' lives better.
